briefdescription.para: Computation is very precise but has a quadratic time complexity with respect to the number of polygon vertices.

detaileddescription.para: In addition, we check a position of the query point with respect to the polygon and use different computation strategies for different positions. This is the default policy.

briefdescription.para: Computation is very precise but has a quadratic time complexity with respect to the number of polygon vertices.

detaileddescription.para: No extra checks are carried out.

briefdescription.para: Computation has a linear time complexity with respect to the number of polygon vertices, but may suffer imprecisions near the polygon boundary.

detaileddescription.para: In addition, we check a position of the query point with respect to the polygon and use different computation strategies for different positions.

briefdescription.para: Computation has a linear time complexity with respect to the number of polygon vertices, but may suffer imprecisions near the polygon boundary.

detaileddescription.para: No extra checks are carried out.

briefdescription.para: Computation_policy_2 provides a way to choose an asymptotic time complexity of the algorithm and its precision for computing 2D barycentric weights and coordinates.
Location is not known apriori and is defined automatically by the algorithm.
Query point is located at one of the polygon's vertices.
Query point is located on the boundary of the polygon.
Query point is located inside the polygon, excluding the boundary.
Query point is located outside the polygon, excluding the boundary.
Query_point_location is enumeration with possible locations of a query point provided by the user.

xrefdescription.para: This part of the package is deprecated since the version 5.4 of CGAL.

briefdescription.para: A default slow algorithm, which is as precise as possible.
A fast algorithm, which is less precise but much faster.
Type_of_algorithm is enumeration with possible algorithms to compute coordinates.

xrefdescription.para: This part of the package is deprecated since the version 5.4 of CGAL.

memberdef.argsstring: (const VertexRange &polygon, const typename GeomTraits::Point_2 &query, OutIterator c_begin, const GeomTraits &traits, const PointMap point_map)
memberdef.name: boundary_coordinates_2

briefdescription.para: computes 2D boundary coordinates.

detaileddescription.para: This function computes boundary barycentric coordinates at a given query point with respect to the vertices of a simple polygon, that is one coordinate per vertex. The coordinates are stored in a destination range beginning at c_begin.

If query is at the vertex, the corresponding coordinate is set to one, while all other coordinates are zero. If query is on the edge, the two corresponding coordinates are segment coordinates, while all other coordinates are set to zero. If query is not on the boundary, all the coordinates are set to zero.
Internally, segment_coordinates_2() are used.

parameterdescription.para: a model of ConstRange whose iterator type is RandomAccessIterator
a model of OutputIterator that accepts values of type GeomTraits::FT
a model of BarycentricTraits_2
a model of ReadablePropertyMap whose key type is VertexRange::value_type and value type is GeomTraits::Point_2
an instance of VertexRange with 2D points, which form a simple polygon
a query point
the beginning of the destination range with the computed coordinates
a traits class with geometric objects, predicates, and constructions; this parameter can be omitted if the traits class can be deduced from the point type
an instance of PointMap that maps a vertex from polygon to Point_2

simplesect.para: an output iterator to the element in the destination range, one past the last coordinate stored + the flag indicating whether the query point belongs to the polygon boundary

memberdef.argsstring: (const VertexRange &polygon, const Query_2 &query, OutIterator c_begin, const PointMap point_map=PointMap())
memberdef.name: boundary_coordinates_2

briefdescription.para: computes 2D boundary coordinates.

detaileddescription.para: This is an overload of the function boundary_coordinates_2.

parameterdescription.para: a model of ConstRange whose iterator type is RandomAccessIterator
a model of Kernel::Point_2
a model of OutputIterator that accepts values of type GeomTraits::FT
a model of ReadablePropertyMap whose key type is VertexRange::value_type and value type is Query_2. The default is CGAL::Identity_property_map.
an instance of VertexRange with 2D points, which form a simple polygon
a query point
the beginning of the destination range with the computed coordinates
an instance of PointMap that maps a vertex from polygon to Query_2; the default initialization is provided

simplesect.para: an output iterator to the element in the destination range, one past the last coordinate stored + the flag indicating whether the query point belongs to the polygon boundary

memberdef.argsstring: (const PointRange &polygon, const typename GeomTraits::Point_2 &query, OutIterator w_begin, const GeomTraits &traits, const Computation_policy_2 policy=Computation_policy_2::FAST_WITH_EDGE_CASES)
memberdef.name: discrete_harmonic_weights_2

briefdescription.para: computes 2D discrete harmonic weights.

detaileddescription.para: This function computes 2D discrete harmonic weights at a given query point with respect to the vertices of a strictly convex polygon, that is one weight per vertex. The weights are stored in a destination range beginning at w_begin.

Internally, the class Discrete_harmonic_coordinates_2 is used. If one wants to process multiple query points, it is better to use that class. When using the free function, internal memory is allocated for each query point, while when using the class, it is allocated only once, which is much more efficient. However, for a few query points, it is easier to use this function. It can also be used when the processing time is not a concern.

parameterdescription.para: a model of ConstRange whose iterator type is RandomAccessIterator and value type is GeomTraits::Point_2
a model of OutputIterator that accepts values of type GeomTraits::FT
a model of BarycentricTraits_2
an instance of PointRange with 2D points, which form a strictly convex polygon
a query point
the beginning of the destination range with the computed weights
a traits class with geometric objects, predicates, and constructions; this parameter can be omitted if the traits class can be deduced from the point type
one of the Computation_policy_2; the default is Computation_policy_2::FAST_WITH_EDGE_CASES

simplesect.para: an output iterator to the element in the destination range, one past the last weight stored

memberdef.argsstring: (const PointRange &polygon, const typename GeomTraits::Point_2 &query, OutIterator c_begin, const GeomTraits &traits, const Computation_policy_2 policy=Computation_policy_2::PRECISE_WITH_EDGE_CASES)

memberdef.name: segment_coordinates_2

briefdescription.para: computes segment coordinates.

detaileddescription.para: This function computes barycentric coordinates at a given query point with respect to the end points p0 and p1 of a segment that is one coordinate per end point. The coordinates are stored in a destination range beginning at c_begin.

After the coordinates $b_0$ and $b_1$ are computed, the query point $q$ can be obtained as $q = b_0p_0 + b_1p_1$. If $q$ does not belong to the line through $p_0$ and $p_1$, it is projected onto this line, and only then the coordinates are computed. See more details in the user manual here.

parameterdescription.para: a model of OutputIterator that accepts values of type GeomTraits::FT
a model of BarycentricTraits_2
the first vertex of a segment
the second vertex of a segment
a query point
the beginning of the destination range with the computed coordinates
a traits class with geometric objects, predicates, and constructions; this parameter can be omitted if the traits class can be deduced from the point type

simplesect.para: an output iterator to the element in the destination range, one past the last coordinate stored

memberdef.argsstring: (const typename GeomTraits::Point_2 &p0, const typename GeomTraits::Point_2 &p1, const typename GeomTraits::Point_2 &p2, const typename GeomTraits::Point_2 &query, OutIterator c_begin, const GeomTraits &traits)
memberdef.name: triangle_coordinates_2

briefdescription.para: computes triangle coordinates.

detaileddescription.para: This function computes barycentric coordinates at a given query point with respect to the points p0, p1, and p2, which form a triangle, that is one coordinate per point. The coordinates are stored in a destination range beginning at c_begin.
After the coordinates $b_0$, $b_1$, and $b_2$ are computed, the query point $q$ can be obtained as $q = b_0p_0 + b_1p_1 + b_2p_2$. See more details in the user manual here.

parameterdescription.para: a model of OutputIterator that accepts values of type GeomTraits::FT
a model of BarycentricTraits_2
the first vertex of a triangle
the second vertex of a triangle
the third vertex of a triangle
a query point
the beginning of the destination range with the computed coordinates
a traits class with geometric objects, predicates, and constructions; this parameter can be omitted if the traits class can be deduced from the point type

simplesect.para: an output iterator to the element in the destination range, one past the last coordinate stored

memberdef.argsstring: (const PointRange &polygon, const typename GeomTraits::Point_2 &query, OutIterator w_begin, const GeomTraits &traits, const Computation_policy_2 policy=Computation_policy_2::FAST_WITH_EDGE_CASES)
memberdef.name: wachspress_weights_2

briefdescription.para: computes 2D Wachspress weights.

detaileddescription.para: This function computes 2D Wachspress weights at a given query point with respect to the vertices of a strictly convex polygon, that is one weight per vertex. The weights are stored in a destination range beginning at w_begin.

Internally, the class Wachspress_coordinates_2 is used. If one wants to process multiple query points, it is better to use that class. When using the free function, internal memory is allocated for each query point, while when using the class, it is allocated only once, which is much more efficient. However, for a few query points, it is easier to use this function. It can also be used when the processing time is not a concern.

a model of OutputIterator that accepts values of type GeomTraits::FT
a model of BarycentricTraits_2
an instance of PointRange with 2D points, which form a strictly convex polygon
a query point
the beginning of the destination range with the computed weights
a traits class with geometric objects, predicates, and constructions; this parameter can be omitted if the traits class can be deduced from the point type
one of the Computation_policy_2; the default is Computation_policy_2::FAST_WITH_EDGE_CASES

simplesect.para: an output iterator to the element in the destination range, one past the last weight stored

memberdef.argsstring: (const PointRange &polygon, const typename GeomTraits::Point_2 &query, OutIterator c_begin, const GeomTraits &traits, const Computation_policy_2 policy=Computation_policy_2::PRECISE_WITH_EDGE_CASES)

briefdescription.para: The namespace Barycentric_coordinates contains implementations of all generalized barycentric coordinates: 2D, 3D, related enumerations, etc.
